# fragment-cache

> A cache for managing namespaced sub-caches

## Install

Install with [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/):

```bash
$ npm install --save fragment-cache
```

## Usage

```javascript
var Fragment = require('fragment-cache');
var fragment = new Fragment();
```

## API

### [FragmentCache](https://github.com/bgoonz/Knowledge-Bank/tree/d157cab4a536be397d8f7d36c79f7d69d282500a/ARCHIVE/BenchBnB/node_modules/fragment-cache/index.js#L24)

Create a new `FragmentCache` with an optional object to use for `caches`.

**Example**

```javascript
var fragment = new FragmentCache();
```

**Params**

* `cacheName` **{String}**
* `returns` **{Object}**: Returns the [map-cache](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/map-cache) instance.

### [.cache](https://github.com/bgoonz/Knowledge-Bank/tree/d157cab4a536be397d8f7d36c79f7d69d282500a/ARCHIVE/BenchBnB/node_modules/fragment-cache/index.js#L49)

Get cache `name` from the `fragment.caches` object. Creates a new `MapCache` if it doesn't already exist.

**Example**

```javascript
var cache = fragment.cache('files');
console.log(fragment.caches.hasOwnProperty('files'));
//=> true
```

**Params**

* `cacheName` **{String}**
* `returns` **{Object}**: Returns the [map-cache](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/map-cache) instance.

### [.set](https://github.com/bgoonz/Knowledge-Bank/tree/d157cab4a536be397d8f7d36c79f7d69d282500a/ARCHIVE/BenchBnB/node_modules/fragment-cache/index.js#L67)

Set a value for property `key` on cache `name`

**Example**

```javascript
fragment.set('files', 'somefile.js', new File({path: 'somefile.js'}));
```

**Params**

* `name` **{String}**
* `key` **{String}**: Property name to set
* `val` **{any}**: The value of `key`
* `returns` **{Object}**: The cache instance for chaining

### [.has](https://github.com/bgoonz/Knowledge-Bank/tree/d157cab4a536be397d8f7d36c79f7d69d282500a/ARCHIVE/BenchBnB/node_modules/fragment-cache/index.js#L93)

Returns true if a non-undefined value is set for `key` on fragment cache `name`.

**Example**

```javascript
var cache = fragment.cache('files');
cache.set('somefile.js');

console.log(cache.has('somefile.js'));
//=> true

console.log(cache.has('some-other-file.js'));
//=> false
```

**Params**

* `name` **{String}**: Cache name
* `key` **{String}**: Optionally specify a property to check for on cache `name`
* `returns` **{Boolean}**

### [.get](https://github.com/bgoonz/Knowledge-Bank/tree/d157cab4a536be397d8f7d36c79f7d69d282500a/ARCHIVE/BenchBnB/node_modules/fragment-cache/index.js#L115)

Get `name`, or if specified, the value of `key`. Invokes the [cache](fragment-cache.md#cache) method, so that cache `name` will be created it doesn't already exist. If `key` is not passed, the entire cache \(`name`\) is returned.

**Example**

```javascript
var Vinyl = require('vinyl');
var cache = fragment.cache('files');
cache.set('somefile.js', new Vinyl({path: 'somefile.js'}));
console.log(cache.get('somefile.js'));
//=> <File "somefile.js">
```

**Params**

* `name` **{String}**
* `returns` **{Object}**: Returns cache `name`, or the value of `key` if specified
